intro: Tragia gentryi, commonly known as Gentry's prickly stick, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, showy flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Tragia gentryi is adapted to arid environments, with thick leaves and a robust root system to conserve water. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
